page.title: 02Blue Anchor railway Station
page.content: The station was opened in 1874 by The Great Western Railway. The original name was Bradley Gate. In 1904 the station was then rebuilt, a double track and a passing loop were put in as before there was only one track. The track from Washford to Blue Anchor is a steep of 1 in 65.The road goes over the railway line and the gates are controlled by the person in the signal box which has a 17 lever frame.In order to celebrate the 150th Birthday the station is being converted into a museum.The line was reopened in March 1976 between Blue Anchor and Minehead.
